results.title: The Deadly cursed moon
results.brief_description: A one player, multi-level game where a knight must accumulate magic spheres to get to the next level without being hit by the deadly cursed moon.

results.title: The Dead zone
results.creator_credit: Debra Hill, Columbia Pictures, Rastar Productions and David Cronenberg
results.brief_description: Faithfully adapted from the Stephen King novel of the same name, this is the chilling story of a man who wakes up from a five-year coma with the extraordinary power to see visions of the past, present and, most frightening, the future. A tense and thought provoking production in which Walken gives one of his most intense and believable performances.

results.title: The Dead Weight of a Quarrel Hangs
results.brief_description: Walid Raad’s Dead weight of a quarrel hangs examines the legacy of the Lebanese Civil War through the stories omitted or seen as unimportant in the official histories. Remnants of film and photography, snapshots and surveillance video footage are transformed to create an archive to “another” Lebanese Civil War.

results.title: The Dead next door
results.creator_credit: Suburban Tempe, Amsco Studios and J.R. Bookwalter
results.brief_description: J.R. Bookwalter’s The Dead Next Door is more than a passing homage to director George A. Romero’s ‘Living Dead’ trilogy. Shot on super-8 and partly financed by director Sam Raimi, this super low budget effort might be creaky at times but enthusiastically serves up the gore to considerable effect. The thin plot concerns a crack team of soldiers know as The Zombie squad who are called in to contain a virus that is bringing the dead back to life. Of course the zombies aren’t content with just being re-animated, as they chew their way through the human race leaving a messy trail behind them. Complicating the commandos squads mission further is an insane religious cult whose sole aim is to keep the zombies fed and alive in preparation for the final day of reckoning when the dead will finally replace the living. Cast includes Peter Ferry, Bogdan Pecic, Jolie Jackunas, Robert Kokai.

results.title: The Dead mother = La Madre muerta [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Gasteizko Zinema and Juanma Bajo Ulloa
results.brief_description: A thief, a cold blooded murder, a child witness and a jealous girlfriend provide the scenario for this intense and evocative psycho-thriller by second-time director Juanma Bajo Ulloa (Butterfly wings = Alas de mariposa, 1991). The thief, Ismael (Karra Elejalde) is interrupted during a robbery when the woman of the house unexpectedly returns. Without any hesitation, Ismael proceeds to cold-bloodedly kill the woman and only as he makes his escape does he realise that the murder has been silently witnessed by the woman’s young daughter, Leire. Many years later Leire (Ana Alvarez) and Ismael’s paths cross. Terrified that he may be exposed by the truth, Ismael decides to kidnap Leire and hold her prisoner in his derelict squat, much to his girlfriend Maite’s (Lio) annoyance and frustration. Leire, however, having been traumatised by the witnessing of her mother’s murder, has grown up as a mute. As Ismael’s interest in Liere turns from fear to an almost obsessive attraction, Liere unwittingly finds herself becoming part of a complex and dangerous love triangle, which can only lead to a twisted and violent conclusion, particularly in light of Maite’s extreme jealousy towards Leire. A film of suspense and intrigue peppered with moments of dark humour and acted by a superb cast including Silvia Marso, Elena Irureta, Ramon Barea. Winner of many international film festival awards (Montreal, Stockholm, Sao Paulo etc) including Best Film, Best Director, Best Actress (Ana Alvarez) and Best Actor (Karra Elejalde). In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dead heart [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Spencer, ABC-TV (Australia), BBC and Oxford Film and Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australia: beyond the fatal shore [Widescreen]”.
Art critic Robert Hughes reflects on his relationship to Australia, 35 years after leaving the country. Contemplative after his near fatal car accident, Hughes reflects fondly on his childhood in Australia with an appreciation that only came from questioning his mortality. Episode two explores Australia’s national pride and nostalgia with the outback - despite the fact that only 1% of the population actually live there. Hughes traces the myths borne out of the bush that have dominated our history and folklore - especially in art - covering icons such as the shearer, the swagman, the explorer and the lost child. He also visits a sheep-shearing station, an Aboriginal community in the Kimberleys, Port Arthur historical site, an opal mine in Coober Pedy, forest in Tasmania and Ayers Rock. Native title and the myth of an infinitely rich and exploitable landscape are also discussed.

results.title: The Dead bird
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films (U.S.), Moreland-Latchford Productions and Graham Parker
results.brief_description: A short story by Margaret Wise Brown which encourages young readers to expect a rewarding experience from reading and to write a story themselves from casual incidents in their own lives. The theme of the film, the dead bird, also lends itself to discussion about the naturalness of death, leading to an appraisal of the essential values in living

results.title: The Dead
results.creator_credit: Vestron Pictures, Zenith, Channel Four, Delta Films, Liffey Films, Wieland Schulz-Keil, Chris Sievernich and John Huston
results.brief_description: It is January 6, 1904, on a snowy night in Dublin; a festive night at the Morkan house, as Miss Kate, Miss Julia and their niece Mary Jane prepare for their annual party. In this his last film, John Huston, captures the wonderful mix of comedy and quiet tragedy portrayed in James Joyce’s short stroy from “The Dubliners”. As the evening progresses, the characters subtly betray their secret lives, culminating in the moment when Gabriel, the calm observer, learns a secret that will change his life forever. A beautiful, eloquent film.

results.title: The Daytrippers
results.creator_credit: Fiasco Photoplays, Trick Film Studios, Nancy Tenenbaum, Steven Soderbergh and Greg Mottola
results.brief_description: This low budget gem is a charming take on the road movie genre which balances equal amounts of humour and melancholy as it traces a day in the life of a middle class American family. The films events are set off by a love letter that is discovered one morning by Eliza D’Amico (Hope Davis), which is addressed to her husband Louis (Stanley Tucci) and is signed, ‘Forever Sandy’. The distraught Eliza enlists the advice of her close knit family who decide the best course of action is to head into the city and confront Louis at work. So Eliza, her parents, her younger sister Jo (Parker Posey), and her sister’s bookish boyfriend, Carl (Liev Schreiber), all jump in the family car and head to Manhattan. The film then takes on a classic road movie structure as they meet various people on their trip, suffer a few mishaps, and have their own personal revelations along the way. The script by first time director Greg Mottola is full of tender observations and sharp one liners, while the film boasts a wonderful ensemble cast which also includes Pat McNamara, Annie Meara and Campbell Scott.

results.title: The Days the world went mad
results.creator_credit: Max Morgan-Witts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A documentary of natural disasters compiled from film footage gathered from all over the world. Earthquakes, tidal waves, eruptions, tornadoes and hurricanes are all recorded. Includes unique footage of the Alaskan earthquake.
